name: Smart Skills Installer CLI
description: A C# toolset that inspects installed libraries in a .NET project and automatically installs relevant agent skills by fetching them from remote sources (public GitHub repositories or authenticated Azure DevOps URLs). The primary acquisition mechanism is MSBuild integrationâ€”skills are resolved and installed as part of the build pipeline via custom MSBuild targets/tasks. A companion CLI tool is provided for manual operations, diagnostics, and configuration.
goals: Automate the discovery and installation of agent skills based on project dependencies
Provide MSBuild-native integration so skills are acquired automatically during build
Support multiple remote skill sources (GitHub, Azure DevOps)
Provide a seamless developer experience with minimal configurationâ€”just add a NuGet package
Ensure secure credential handling for authenticated sources
Support incremental builds so skill acquisition only runs when dependencies change

tasks.title: Implement Commit-SHA-Based Cache in Installation Engine

stories.title: Skills Lock File
stories.description: Introduce a version-controlled lock file (smart-skills.lock.json) that records the exact fetch coordinates and integrity hashes of all tracked skills. Replaces the internal .agents-skills-state.json with a committable, deterministic, cross-platform file that enables reproducible skill installations and local edit detection. See spec/lock-file.md for full specification.

tasks.title: Implement Cross-Platform Content Hashing
tasks.description: Implement the SkillContentHasher that computes a deterministic SHA256 content hash over a skill directory. The hash must be identical on Windows, macOS, and Linux. Algorithm: enumerate files recursively (excluding hidden), normalize paths to forward-slash NFC form, sort ordinally, hash each file's raw bytes, concatenate '<path>\n<hash>\n', then SHA256 the result.
requirements: Enumerate all files recursively, excluding hidden files/directories (starting with '.')
Normalize relative paths: forward slashes, NFC Unicode normalization (String.Normalize(NormalizationForm.FormC))
Sort paths using StringComparison.Ordinal
Read file content as raw bytes (no line-ending conversion)
Compute SHA256 of each file's raw bytes as lowercase hex

Concatenate entries as UTF-8: '<relative-path>
<file-sha256>
' using literal
Compute final SHA256 of concatenated UTF-8 bytes
Return result as 'sha256:<lowercase-hex>'
Handle empty directories (return hash of empty input)

verifications: Same directory produces identical hash across repeated calls
